review_blob: we got it as "faxe red" at my liquor store. its basically faxe premium with red food colouring. never seen a red ale so artificially red looking in my life. cheap beer for cheap people who want to pretend they are expanding their horizons. it looks like white zinfandel. spooky. spooky and strange.

Bottle from Spinnakers spirit merchants Victoria BC. 
Fruity, candy aromas, honeydew.
Carnival candy flavors, cotton candy, bubble gum as well as melon, tropical, creamy and sweet. 
I dig it.
beer_name: BrewDog IPA Is Dead - El Dorado

review_blob:
Bottle purchased from Spinnakers spirit merchants, Victoria BC. 
Hazy, golden amber. half inch of white head. 
Piney aroma, with some good ripe citrus. 
The taste is something special, very woodsy. The first thing i got was cedar, then some honey, pine. Its herbal, spicy very down to earth with a hint of blackberry underneath it all. This is a log cabin in the woods kind of beer, surprised the bottle hasnt grown a beard. 
Nice carbonation adds to the mouthfeel. 
I like what theyve done with this hop.

Pours a hazy, almost opaque golden amber, half inch white head. 
I get a lot of apricot, a little peach, and a little orange citrus on the nose.
The taste was really interesting, a little dusty floral, juicy apricot, very mild citrus, and a note of fresh, un-spiced pumpkin. Its not particularly hoppy but it is very tasty and would definitely be awesome in combination with other hops, maybe some citra or mosaic. Good stuff.

Hazy amber, about one centimeter of thick white head. 
Nose is big time citrus, orangey, grapefruit, little pine. 
Taste is quite bitter, lots of citrus, tangerine. 
Juicy and hoppy, very nice.
Pours hazy, golden yellow with a good inch and a half of thick white head. Taste is light, fruity, apples and apricots and some earthy spices, the green tea really comes through. This is really good.

This is fresh. As fresh as it gets. I got a bottle the first day it was available this year and had to drink it immediately. 
Pours a beautiful light golden/amber with a half inch of head. 
Aroma is pure freshness, fresh picked grapefruit, pine. 
Taste is knee weakening, juicy grapefruit, you can feel the hop oils on your tongue. Purely delicious, If Fat tug is my second favourite IPA of all time, then that bumps this up to my number one. Its like a fresher, juicier Fat tug, I am going to savour the two bottles left I have stashed away and then wait impatiently until next years harvest. Best rating I have ever given a beer. Unbelievably good.

Its a pale+. Heavy on the hops, and still light and crisp. Pours a hazy, deep amber orange, half an inch of foamy white head. Nose is citrus fruit cocktail, fresh peaches, grapefruit, blood orange. Taste is smooth, Grapefruit, peach, and pine notes softened and juicy. Nothing overpowering here, just good balance and great taste. probably one of the most flavourful pales Ive had.

Nice aroma, not overpowering. Mild citrus. Taste is very interesting, typical ipa flavours, citrus and pine and Im getting quite a bit of chocolate which is a little odd but very delicious. Very enjoyable despite being overpriced. Nearly 8 bucks for a 330ml bottle in victoria.
beer_name: Evil Twin Before, During and After Christmas Beer (8%)

review_blob: Poured from 650ml bottle, clear golden amber colour. Grapefruit and juicy, ripe peach on the nose. Mild grapefruit, ripe peach again and maybe a little orange peel to the taste, just enough carbonation to tickle the tongue. Perfect mouthfeel. Its like a hoppy E.S.B. but with Belgian yeast. Very interesting, incredibly tasty, a good place for the hop head and the belgian lover to meet in the middle and share a good beer.

I dont know why im rating this. I guess its beer? i dont know... It pours a light golden colour, not too bad to look at from pilsner or lager standards. Then you taste it, its sickly sweet, must have added sugar, some strange sour tang to it i cant really place. Not something I would ever spend money on. As far as mass produced beers go this one lays on the lowest rung of the beer ladder... the bladder. yeah! something funny came out of this! dont ever buy a six pack of this, if you want to try it for the sake of trying it get a single can and give it the old college try. You will be disappointed. If you like mass produced beer there are hundreds that are way better, and there are THOUSANDS of proper craft brewed beers that are much more worthy of your attention. Yanjing? NOjing!!!

Pours a golden amber with thick frothy head. 
Scent is mildly sweet, deceptively light, candy-like malts. 
Taste is disappointing, overly sweet and nearly astringent, the alcohol comes through forcibly. Somewhat oily on the palate. Too much malty, candy sweetness to be enjoyable. There are many other extra strong belgian beers I prefer over this one. Definitely worth the try but I wont be buying it again.

Purchased bomber at Spinnakers Spirit Merchants, Vic West. 
Pours out a clear, light gold, could easily be mistaken for a lager. Decent head that evaporated quickly. 
Nose is very aromatic, powerful notes of citrus, pine, and floral hops attack the senses in a good way.
Taste is once again, citrus and pine, tangy and light. This is basically their Bottle Rockets older brother. So many similarities though this one has a bit more complexity to it. Very enjoyable.
Palate is nice, has a bit of a sting to it that leaves the mouth watering after a sip. 
All in all, another tasty IPA from Phillips.

Aroma: citrus, blood orange(duh) smooth, not very acidic. 

Appearance: light amber/yellow, mild cloudiness, finger of head, nice lacing.

Taste: Awesome! This Tastes more like an IPA than I was expecting. I was thinking it was going to be a smooth light orangey fruit ale but there is a strong presence of hops that give it a similar flavour to Driftwoods Fat Tug IPA which is my absolute second favourite beer at the moment. This is hoppy, citrusy, complex and flavourful ending with a nice blood orange and yeast aftertaste that fades quickly. 

Overall: This is not at all what I was expecting to find when I bought the bottle(I think a more mild and fruity blood orange beer would be ideal as a summer seasonal) but it is a delicious brew worthy of note. The fact that it reminds me of one of my favourite IPAs definitely helps and probably affected my scoring a little bit. 

Superfuzz, I can dig it. (Yeah i just threw in a tag line, so what?)

unreal. The hops will blow your mind. beautiful clear golden colour, powerful citrus, imperial hop nose with a HARD and warm hop flavor. like a warm bear hug on a cold day. this beer made me weak in the knees. no one is paying be to say this but i wish they were. this beer is a total game changer. amazing balance. just try one.

This is a pilsener, and I feel its getting a bad rap because pilseners arent typically very interesting or flavourful beers. 
There is little to no aroma to be found, slight hints of hay. 
The colour is a beautiful bright wheat yellow.
The taste (for the style of beer it is) is crisp, clean, notes of hay, sweet corn? highly sessionable, and incredibly refreshing. 
Not something I would drink regularly as I usually drink Ipas but steam whistle is perfect for the first beer after a long hard day at work or for a refreshing beer on the patio.
